sys_hub_flow.description:
Processes SObject Record at the Salesforce Webhook Callbacks Event.

Inputs :

  • Action ID - The workflow rule (action) that triggers the message.
  • Session ID - A session ID to be used by endpoint URL client that is responding to the outbound message. It is used by the receiving code to make calls back to Salesforce.
  • Enterprise URL - URL to use to make API calls back to Salesforce using the enterprise WSDL.
  • Partner URL - URL to use to make API calls back to Salesforce using the partner WSDL.
  • Notification ID - A notification ID is used to track redelivery attempts of notifications you've already processed.
  • Records - List of fields of salesforce object record which triggers whenever any SObject record is given at the Salesforce Webhook Callbacks Event.

To use this subflow, a corresponding Salesforce Connection and Credential must be created and associated with the Salesforce Connection & Credential Alias. Learn More

Note: Requires a subscription for production use. Read More.

sys_hub_flow_snapshot.description:
Processes SObject Record at the Salesforce Webhook Callbacks Event.

Inputs :

  • Action ID - The workflow rule (action) that triggers the message.
  • Session ID - A session ID to be used by endpoint URL client that is responding to the outbound message. It is used by the receiving code to make calls back to Salesforce.
  • Enterprise URL - URL to use to make API calls back to Salesforce using the enterprise WSDL.
  • Partner URL - URL to use to make API calls back to Salesforce using the partner WSDL.
  • Notification ID - A notification ID is used to track redelivery attempts of notifications you've already processed.
  • Records - List of fields of salesforce object record which triggers whenever any SObject record is given at the Salesforce Webhook Callbacks Event.

To use this subflow, a corresponding Salesforce Connection and Credential must be created and associated with the Salesforce Connection & Credential Alias. Learn More

Note: Requires a subscription for production use. Read More.
